intro: Eriope alpestris, commonly known as the alpine eriope, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky slopes, where it thrives in cool, temperate climates. Its foliage is often covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a soft, woolly appearance. Eriope alpestris is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens with well-drained soil and full sun.
